title.native: クジラの子らは砂上に歌う
title.romaji: Kujira no Kora wa Sajou ni Utau

description:
Chakuro is the 14-year-old archivist of the Mud Whale, a nigh-utopian island that floats across the surface of an endless sea of sand. Nine in ten of the inhabitants of the Mud Whale have been blessed and cursed with the ability to use saimia, special powers that doom them to an early death.

Chakuro and his friends have stumbled across other islands, but they have never met, seen, or even heard of a human who wasn't from their own. One day, Chakuro visits an island as large as the Mud Whale and meets a girl who will change his destiny.

(Source: Batoto)
synonyms: ลำนำของเหล่าลูกปลาวาฬ
Kujira no Kora - Filhos das Baleias

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

node.description: [Website](http://abiume.blog.fc2.com/)
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).
[Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/hiroakitsutsumi) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiroaki850605)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hal_i_00)

Married to fellow animator [Shingo Adachi](https://anilist.co/staff/110189/).

An art director who worked for Kobayashi Productions, but left together with [Hiromasa Ogura](https://anilist.co/staff/105312/) and Hiroshi Oono to establish Studio Fuga in March 3, 1983. He stayed until 1997, when he left to establish Moonflower, where he also acts as representative director.

[Website](http://www.studio-ik.com/)

Married to [Yukiko Aikei](https://anilist.co/staff/110945).
[Website](http://rionos.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/rionos)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/pemopemo_03)

Freelance animator. Originating from [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/).
Italian voice actress. She was born in Bologna.

She was cast as the Hexenkönigin (witch queen) and Mimi in the German DoReMi.Jahrgang She was born in 1956. She is 165 cm tall, has brown-blonde hair, and green-blue eyes. She can speak English and French as well as German. She plays the guitar and the flute. She is currently living in München.

[Website](http://www.i-am-ririko.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/riripero)

A Japanese guitarist, vocalist, lyricist, and composer.

**Robert Buchholz** is an American producer, voice actor, script/screenwriter, story editor, and voice director. He has produced voices for anime and video games. Robert is the owner of Spliced Bread Productions.

**[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/megblz/)**

**Megan Buchholz** is an American actress, dialogue director and script/screenwriter for anime.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

More recently she has also been involved in storyboarding and episode directing.
Yoshio Ookouchi is a composite artist affiliated with A-1 Pictures.
Previously working at Tavac, now for Real-T.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/松倉友二)

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/) since 1992, where he currently serves as the Executive Officer and General Manager of Production Headquarters. Also the representative director of Jam Creation.

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

Sakurabi made his directional debut with [Gunparade March](https://anilist.co/anime/266/). He is a fan of simple and refreshing love stories. As a director he's known for modifying original stories a lot, which has brought him substantial amounts of critique. He is quite infamous for his work as the director of the [Tsukihime](https://anilist.co/anime/169/) adaptation, with most fans disapproving of his changes from the original visual novel.

Amongst his most notable directorial works are [Yomigaeru Sora: Rescue Wings](https://anilist.co/anime/798/) and [Flying Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/21284/).

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).
